sub_topic: Using the Fourier transform to analyze the frequency content of a signal
message_1:
A signal has a frequency content given by the function 

f(t) = 2cos(3πt) + 3sin(7πt)

What is the frequency content of this signal after applying the Fourier transform? Specifically, what are the frequencies and associated amplitudes present in the signal?
message_2:
The given function is f(t) = 2cos(3πt) + 3sin(7πt). To find the frequency content of this signal after applying the Fourier transform, we can analyze the function in terms of its sinusoidal components.

The first term, 2cos(3πt), has an amplitude of 2 and a frequency of (3π)/2π = 3/2 Hz. The second term, 3sin(7πt), has an amplitude of 3 and a frequency of (7π)/2π = 7/2 Hz.

After applying the Fourier transform, the frequency content of the signal will have two distinct frequencies with their associated amplitudes:

1. Frequency: 3/2 Hz, Amplitude: 2
2. Frequency: 7/2 Hz, Amplitude: 3
